author: Thomas Gebremedhin
title: Q&A with Meg Wolitzer: The Author of ‘The Female Persuasion’
text: MEG WOLITZER’S novels arrive almost like prophecies, so attuned are they to the spirit of their times. The Female Persuasion is no different. Her latest effort spans several decades and charts the political and social development of college student Greer Kadetsky following an encounter with feminist trailblazer Faith Frank. The result is a novel that explores questions of feminism, power, envy and mentorship. Wolitzer, 58, is old-fashioned in the best sense, a spiritual descendant of writers like Elizabeth Gaskell and Charlotte Brontë.
